text: <@U0KPFAZNF> looks like either we have a bad mirror or a problem with the new baseimage build <https://jenkins.hyperledger.org/job/fabric-verify-x86_64/1356/console>
last 5 look like the same issue
hmm, whats odd is the provision/common.sh script is the old stuff
what I thought
what build was this from?
but I am not yet caffinated
i mean, what PR
last 5 have same error
oh
wait
convergence branch
it’s the last 3 convergence branch builds
we need to get that branch updated
yeah, convergence still runs on the v0.0.11 stuff…looks like bad juju in the ubuntu mirror this am
yes
i cant recall if i did already, but I was going to start a thread about how to best keep these branches up to date
well, I wanted to start a thread that sought to figure out how we go forward
one thing we could do is open up merge-pushes for maintainers…and if we are disciplined to only push merges when they are for syncing branches...
because with v0.6 cut, we can probably cut over to master
yeah
though the problem still remains in general
yes
(theres already something in v0.6 i need to merge downward)
me too
<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/1195/>
I need to get Binh this morning and see if theres anything else he thinks we missed
gerrit seems to be friendly to merges if you use the —no-ff so that it creates a merge record…the question really is: is there anything we can do to prevent abuse
well, not so much abuse
but accidental pollution
(we had all kinds of hideous merge records in GH that I would like to avoid)
some other ideas: perhaps there is a jenkins job that is authorized to submit merges
that seems like it would be hard to get right though
heres an idea: maybe the V+1 stage can check for the simple “I synced a branch” vs “I have a messy merge"
it was odd, because when I went to produce a release notes, I saw all kinds of merge records in the log
not sure what that would look like, but that would solve the problem
well, the way we have gerrit configured, _gerrit_ creates merge records
its just that users cannot submit them
On other projects we use the --no-ff as noted
so its not that we are merge record free per se, we just only have one entity that can generate them
<@U0UHG4VP1>, cool
we could only grant the “push merge” ACL to maintainers or something, to limit the risk
whats unclear to me is, is it easy to spy the difference between a simple branch sync and other type of merge records when they get submitted for review
my guess is: unintended merge records probably wouldnt have a ChangeID
A pure merge won't generate a review
so maybe that would be a good gate
<@U0UHG4VP1>: hmm…is it possible to submit a merge for review if you want?
i thought it was, but maybe I misunderstood
If you do '--no-ff' yes
right, ok
Feel free to mess with the sandbox
right, ok
does that have <https://review.typo3.org/Documentation/access-control.html#category_push_merge> turned on?
I’ve turned it on.
ty
<@U0XR6J961|simon> has left the channel
